question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

Each recall must be formally recognized by the respective company (Coca-Cola or Danone) or a relevant food safety authority (for example, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reliable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically pertain to metallic elements present in the food items. If neither of the companies issues such a recall within the specified timeframe, the answer to the question will be negative.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Another U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024 (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

This question will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, a well-known cybersecurity company has completely moved its headquarters from its former location to Austin, Texas. For a positive answer to be given:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leaders.
2. The announcement should be reported by at least two major, credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial moves or plans that are still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not qualify for a YES response. If the move is not completed and active by this date, or if the company decides against the relocation, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will California hold a referendum on gun control measures by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on gun control measures. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address gun control, either proposing to introduce new regulations or to relax existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on gun control does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

This question will be answered with a YES only if both of the following criteria are met:

(a) Indiana conducts a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024. For this condition to be confirmed as YES, the following requirements must be fulfilled:
   1. The vote must be officially announced and executed by the state of Indiana.
   2. The primary focus of the vote must be the safeguarding of abortion rights.
   3. The outcome of the vote must be disclosed through official state announcements or widely recognized news organizations.
   If such a vote that meets these conditions does not occur by August 31, 2024, this condition will be marked as NO.

(b) Colorado enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical treatment for transgender youth by July 31, 2024. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Colorado news stations). The new law must specifically address and change the existing restrictions on medical treatment for transgender youth in Colorado. If no such law is passed by the deadline, or if any law that is passed does not alter the existing limitations, this part will be resolved as NO.

The overall inquiry will receive a YES answer only if both (a) and (b) are verified as YES.

question.title: Will Tennessee enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Arkansas Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Arkansas Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Arkansas legislative records. question.title: Will Adobe announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Adobe publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Adobe only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, Adobe makes a public declaration regarding intentions to expand its workforce dedicated to AI. Should no such declaration occur by the given date, or if Adobe only states plans to maintain or reduce its AI-related workforce, the inquiry will be resolved as negative. It is important to note that this question pertains to the announcement of intentions, rather than the actual execution of those intentions.

question.title: Will Stanford University fully cover tuition for undergraduate students from lower-income families by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Stanford University officially implements a policy to fully cover tuition for undergraduate students from families earning less than $100,000 annually. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Reuters, Associated Press). The policy must be in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or earlier. If such a policy is not confirmed to be in place by the resolution date, or if the income threshold or coverage details differ significantly from those specified, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Apple's Siri be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Apple's Siri is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Siri and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Tennessee hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Tennessee officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Tennessee state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Tennessee-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Tennessee and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

The referendum must be publicly announced by the Tennessee state officials and validated by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or significant news outlets within Tennessee). The referendum should be available to all eligible voters in Tennessee and should focus specifically on abortion rights. If such a referendum does not occur or is not completed by the deadline, or if it is postponed or canceled beyond July 31, 2024, the response to this question will be NO. It is crucial to understand that this inquiry pertains solely to whether the vote takes place, not its outcome.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Apple's Siri be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024, and (b) Tennessee hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Apple's Siri is spreading election misinformation. question.title: Will Harvard University fully cover tuition for medical students from lower-income families by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Harvard University officially implements a policy to fully cover tuition for medical students from families earning less than $100,000 annually. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Reuters, Associated Press). The policy must be in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or earlier. If such a policy is not confirmed to be in place by the resolution date, or if the income threshold or coverage details differ significantly from those specified, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will Harvard University provide complete tuition coverage for medical students hailing from low-income families?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, Harvard University officially adopts a policy that fully funds tuition for medical students whose families earn below $100,000 per year. Verification must be obtained from official announcements from the university or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Reuters, Associated Press). question.title: Will New York hold a referendum on climate change policies by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of New York officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on implementing climate change policies in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the New York Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of climate change policies. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will the UK economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by the end of July 2024, the UK economy has not fallen into a recession. For the context of this question, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The inquiry will be considered negative if the UK economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of GDP decline at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of New Zealand announce a new economic stimulus package by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand officially announces a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of New Zealand communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of New Zealand. The announcement should explicitly describe the new economic stimulus package. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of New Zealand maintains the current economic policy, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. The 3,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

question.title: Will Texas enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Texas enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the U.S. government resume consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. If no such resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration remains in effect, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the approval of any specific projects, only the resumption of the consideration process.

question.title: Will BYD's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if BYD reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) The U.S. government resumes consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects, and (2) BYD's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) The U.S. federal government officially resumes the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). This resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal. The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. (2) BYD reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. This increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or Wall Street Journal. If either condition is not met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.body:

question.title: Will the FTC announce completion of a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 and will the FTC complete a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
   2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   The question will resolve as NO if:
   1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
   2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
   3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
   Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

For this combined question to resolve as YES, both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied within their respective timeframes.

   1. The vote must be officially announced and executed by the authorities in Georgia.
   2. The vote must specifically focus on the issue of safeguarding abortion rights.
   3. The results of the vote must be made publicly available through official state communications or widely recognized news outlets.
   This inquiry will be deemed negative if:
   1. No such vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
   2. A planned vote is canceled or postponed past the specified date.
   3. A vote occurs, but it does not specifically address establishing protections for abortion rights.
   Note: The resolution of this inquiry does not take into account the results of the vote, only whether it occurs within the designated timeframe.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the conclusion of its investigation into pricing practices that utilize personal data to adjust prices based on individual shopping habits. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. The conclusion must be confirmed via an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not announce the conclusion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation remains ongoing, the inquiry will be resolved negatively.

For this combined inquiry to be resolved positively, both criteria (a) and (b) must be satisfied within their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Cracker Jack in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Missouri remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Spotify announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Spotify officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the Italian economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy has not entered a recession. For the context of this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The inquiry will be deemed negative if the Italian economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If no new President is appointed by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, remains in office, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

4. The bill must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets regarding its potential effect on the UK economy.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United States implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles. The implementation must be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for the United States to introduce a major tariff on electric vehicles produced in China by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially enacts a tariff of 50% or more on the importation of electric vehicles made in China. This enactment must be validated through official announcements from the U.S. government and covered by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must be directed specifically at electric vehicles from China and not be part of a broader tariff affecting all Chinese products or all types of vehicles. If such a tariff that meets these specifications is not enacted by the designated date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will India's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Satya Nadella on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Satya Nadella must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Nvidia announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Nvidia officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). question.title: Will Samsung announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Samsung publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Samsung only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Mexico's economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, Mexico's economy does not fall into a recession. For the sake of this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as indicated by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The inquiry will be deemed negative if Mexico's economy encounters two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Mexico's economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the economy of Mexico does not fall into a recession. For this context, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as documented by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The response will be negative if Mexico's economy faces two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Mexico avoid entering a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered positively if, on July 31, 2024, Mexico's economy has not entered a recession. question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if Hyundai Motor Company successfully negotiates with union workers, leading to the conclusion of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this conclusion to hold:

1. The strike must engage a considerable number of workers from Hyundai Motor Company (minimum of 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must endure for a minimum duration of one week.
3. Confirmation of the resolution must be made through official announcements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the participating union.
4. The outcome must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no resolution that meets all these conditions is reached by the indicated date, or if no significant strike takes place, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

This question will receive a YES response if Hyundai Motor Company effectively negotiates with its unionized workforce, resulting in the termination of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the answer to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company employees (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for a minimum of one week.
3. The result must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the pertinent union.
4. The resolution must be reported by no fewer than two reliable international news organizations (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If a resolution that satisfies all these criteria is not achieved by the given date, or if there is no major strike, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The European Central Bank announces an interest rate cut, and (b) Hyundai Motor Company resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following events occur by July 31, 2024:

(a) The European Central Bank (ECB) officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution.

(b) Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. For the resolution to be considered valid, the strike must involve at least 1,000 Hyundai Motor Company workers, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union. Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If either of these events does not occur by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Shopify has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the International Monetary Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's climate disclosure rule be reinstated by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's rule on climate disclosures, previously blocked by a court decision, is reinstated. The reinstatement must be confirmed by official court documents or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The reinstatement could occur through a successful appeal, a reversal of the court's decision, or any other legal mechanism that results in the rule taking effect. If the rule remains blocked or is not reinstated by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially approves MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) for use as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the approval must be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, not for any other condition or use. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly rejects or delays the approval beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Israel announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will large protests occur in the United Kingdom in response to healthcare funding cuts by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

For the protests to qualify as 'major', they must consist of no fewer than 1,000 individuals in a single event or a series of coordinated events that together draw at least 1,000 participants across the UK. The protests must be clearly related to the issue of reductions in healthcare funding. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the deadline, or if the funding cuts are reversed before triggering such protests, the response to the question will be negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the Central Bank of Israel announces an interest rate cut, and (b) large protests occur in the UK in response to healthcare funding cuts?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate, confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, this part of the question resolves as NO. (b) There are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, this part of the question resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, at any time in August 2024, the typical interest rate for a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as documented by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, goes beyond 5.5%. This rate must be validated by official publications from Freddie Mac or credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not surpass 5.5% at any moment during August 2024, the answer will be negative. To clarify, the rate must exceed 5.5%, not just match it.
